dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4927 IH: Consumer Access to Broadband for Local Economies and Competition Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Houchin (for herself and Mr. Goldman of Texas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Communications Act of 1934 to prohibit franchising authorities from requiring approval for the sale of cable systems, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Consumer Access to Broadband for Local Economies and Competition Act or the CABLE Competition Act.

subsection.text: Section 627 of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 547) is amended to read as follows:

subsection.header: Value of cable system after revocation of franchise
subsection.text: If a franchise held by a cable operator is revoked under section 626(b)(2)(B) and the franchising authority acquires ownership of the cable system or effects a transfer of ownership of the system to another person, any such acquisition or transfer shall be at fair market value.

subsection.header: Limitations on authority of franchising authority with respect To transfer of franchise

paragraph.text: A franchising authority may not preclude a cable operator from transferring a franchise to any person—

subparagraph.text: to which such franchise was not initially granted; and
with respect to the terms of the franchise that apply to the cable operator, who agrees to accept all such terms in effect at the time of the transfer.

paragraph.text: In the case of the transfer of a franchise to a person to which such franchise was not originally granted, a franchising authority may require a cable operator to which a franchise was initially granted to, not later than 15 days before the transfer of the franchise, notify the franchising authority in writing of such transfer.
In this subsection, the term transfer of a franchise means the transfer or assignment of any rights under a franchise through any transaction, including through—

subparagraph.text: a merger involving the cable operator or cable system;
a sale of the cable operator or cable system;
an assignment of the cable operator or a cable system;
a restructuring of a cable operator or a cable system; or
the transfer of control of a cable operator or a cable system.

subsection.text: This section, and the amendment made by subsection (a), shall take effect 6 months after the date of the enactment of this Act.
This section, and the amendment made by subsection (a), shall apply to a franchise granted—

paragraph.text: on or after the effective date established by subsection (b); or

subparagraph.text: such franchise (including any renewal term thereof) is in effect on such date; or
such franchise is expired and cable operator has continued to perform under the provisions of such franchise as if such franchise were not expired.
